newsitem.title: USA: CME hogs sharply lower-limit down on fund selling.
newsitem.headline: CME hogs sharply lower-limit down on fund selling.

text.p: CME hogs were sharply lower to limit down around mid-morning, depressed by fund selling, floor traders said.
R.J. O' Brien, Refco and LIT were featured sellers.
Weak cash hogs on Tuesday, following a sharp drop in pork prices on Monday, helped to initially depress values and the decline gathered momentum as stops were hit, traders said.
At 1030 CDT October and December were locked the 1.50 cent limit down, while most deferred "lean" contracts were the 2.00 cent limit lower.
December was offered 1.50 cent down at 52.100 cents.
The fall in hogs sparked selling in the pork belly pit with February 2.750 cent easier at 65.550 cents. Other contracts were sharply lower to the three cent limit down.
USDA reported that cash hogs in the interior Iowa-south Minnesota market were off $0.50 on Tuesday with a plant top of $54.00 per cwt.
The fall followed a drop in USDA pork cut-out values Monday of $1.17 to $1.01 per cwt.
